results.title: Bashar al-Assad Steps In From the Cold, but Syria Is Still Shattered
results.abstract: Arab countries are gradually restoring ties with Syria, but its president remains mired in crises he can’t escape.

results.title: ‘This Drop Came So Quickly’: Shrinking Schools Add to Hong Kong Exodus
results.abstract: The Chinese territory is experiencing its biggest population drop in decades as residents flee political repression and a new “patriotic” curriculum.

results.abstract: Results showed the party of Muqtada al-Sadr making the biggest gains in a vote that could help shape Iraq’s direction and its relationship with both the United States and Iran.

results.title: Who Killed African Icon Thomas Sankara? Trial Opens, 34 Years After His Death.
results.abstract: The president of the West African nation of Burkina Faso, an anticolonial leader celebrated across the continent, was assassinated in 1987. Now 14 men, including the president who took his place, are on trial.
des_facet: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

multimedia.caption: Thomas Sankara, the president of Burkina Faso, was known for taking on former colonial powers, as well as the World Bank and International Monetary Fund. He was 37 when he was killed.

results.title: Missing Apostrophe in Facebook Post Lands a Man in Defamation Court
results.abstract: An Australian man claimed a real estate agent did not pay its “employees” retirement funds. The lack of a punctuation mark may cost him thousands.

results.title: Where Parents Have Abducted Their Own Children in a Bid for Custody
results.abstract: For years, thousands of children in China have been taken and hidden. The practice rose along with the nation’s divorce rate. A new law aims to curb the practice.
results.byline: By Amy Qin and Amy Chang Chien

multimedia.caption: Mothers playing with their children in Shanghai. Custody battles after a divorce can be especially acrimonious in China, where courts rarely grant joint physical custody.
Mothers playing with their children in Shanghai. Custody battles after a divorce can be especially acrimonious in China, where courts rarely grant joint physical custody.

results.title: ‘I Never Believed That Would Happen’: After 20 Years of War, an Abrupt End
results.abstract: Amid the uncertainty that lies ahead under a Taliban-controlled government, Afghans reflect on the final months of fighting.
results.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Victor J. Blue, Jim Huylebroek and Christina Goldbaum
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: In Debate Over Conquistadors 500 Years Ago, Spanish Right Sees an Opportunity
results.abstract: Spanish politicians sparred with Pope Francis over their country’s role in conquering the Americas, signaling a nationalist tilt in the conservative establishment.

multimedia.caption: The leader of Spain’s Popular Party, Pablo Casado, arriving at a bullfighting ring for the last day of the annual party convention in Valencia last Sunday.
